user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_panic_std:
```c
_MHD_NORETURN static void
mhd_panic_std (void *cls,
               const char *file,
               unsigned int line,
               const char *reason)
{
  (void) cls; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  fprintf (stderr,
           _ ("Fatal error in GNU libmicrohttpd %s:%u: %s\n"),
           file,
           line,
           reason);
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) file;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) line;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) reason; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif
  abort ();
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function mhd_panic_std:
#define _MHD_NORETURN _Noreturn
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
...
#define _(String) (String)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) file;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) line;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) reason; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The three (void) cast statements are inside a #else branch of #ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES. Given HAVE_MESSAGES is defined as 1 in the provided definitions, that #else branch is not compiled into this build; it is not present in the translation unit and therefore not runtime-unreachable code. Furthermore, the #else branch would be compiled in builds where HAVE_MESSAGES is not defined, so the code is not inherently unreachable across the project. No code path within the compiled function is unreachable (the function ends with abort() and is annotated as _Noreturn).
